result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph P Olszewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

*Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended by the agent.

*  Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph P Olszewski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: joint/several with Cody S Grubba and Jordan P Feltz

Defendant Joseph P Olszewski in court.   Atty Erik McFarland in court for defendant, Joseph P Olszewski.  Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CM308, 15CT308 and 15CT84.

8:43 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
State has complied with victim notification; but no victim's appear in court today.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM308:
Count 1 - DRI 
Count 2 - No contest
Count 3 - No contest 
Count 4 - DRI
Count 5 - DRI
Count 6 - DRI

15CT308:
Count 1 - DRI

15CT84:
Count 1 -  No contest 
Count 2 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Court review's the criminal complaints in 15CM308 and 15CT84.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 2 & 3 in 15CM308 and Count's 1, 4, 5 & 6 are DRI, Count 1 in 15CT308 is DRI and guilty in Count 1 of 15CT84 and Count 2 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CM308:
Count 1 - DRI

Count 2 -
Impose/Stay 90 day jail sentence - huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reasons the sheriff will allow 1/2 to be served on home monitor (only if probation revoked) and approved by the jail/risk assessment.
Placed on 18 months probation
Conditions of Probation:
Perform 30 hours of community service
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Pay restitution in the amount of $158 to be joint/several with co-defendants, Cody Grubba and Jordan Feltz.
Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended by the agent.
Pay costs/surcharges - DNA surcharge 
Provide a DNA sample
Eligible for early discharge if complete the recommendations of probation and approved by the agent.
Court will grant expungement is successfully completes probation.
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

Count 3 -
Impose/Stay 90 day jail sentence to run concurrent with Count 1 
Placed on 18 months probation Concurrent to Count 1 
Pay costs/surcharges - DNA surcharge
Comply with conditions in Count 1 

Count 4 - DRI
Count 5 - DRI
Count 6 - DRI

15CT308:
Count 1 - DRI

15CT84:
Count 1 -
Pay $100 fine plus costs
Zero day jail
Zero days suspension
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

Count 2 - DRI

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph P Olszewski in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received a copy of the Criminal Complaint
Defendant waives reading of Criminal Complaint
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties
Court advises defendant of right to counsel and can contact Public Defender's office for representation.

Defendant would like to consult with an attorney
Defendant can contact Public Defender for Representation
Court orders defendant to see Public Defender today. 

Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.
